sections.title: Essential Account Types
sections.content: Every financial plan needs different types of accounts for different purposes. Checking accounts for daily transactions, savings accounts for emergencies, investment accounts for long-term growth, and retirement accounts for tax-advantaged saving. Choose accounts based on fees, accessibility, and features.

points.title: Checking Accounts
points.description: Look for no-fee accounts with good mobile banking and ATM access.

points.title: Savings Accounts
points.description: Prioritize high interest rates, easy transfers, and federal insurance (FDIC/NCUA).

points.title: Investment Accounts
points.description: Choose low-cost platforms with good research tools and educational resources.

sections.title: Start with High-Yield Savings
sections.content: Traditional savings accounts pay very low interest. Online high-yield savings accounts often pay 4-5% APY with no fees and full FDIC insurance.

sections.title: Choosing Financial Institutions
sections.content: Consider online banks for higher interest rates, credit unions for lower fees and better service, and traditional banks for in-person service and convenience. Compare fees, interest rates, mobile app quality, and customer service before choosing.

sections.title: Automate Where Possible
sections.content: Set up automatic transfers from checking to savings and investment accounts. Automation ensures consistency and removes the temptation to spend money earmarked for other purposes.
